td.a: Update from our Special Services Department

img.br: Here is some information from the Special Services Department including some instructions on how to access the IEP Parent Portal.

td.a: Update to District Communication Regarding the Coronavirus 4/2/2020

img.br:
This is the latest update from Superintendent Dan Streeter to our families with regards to the latest information from the State School Board regarding grading for the remainder of the school year.
We have also included a Commonly Asked Questions document, Meal Service information and some area resources at the bottom of the page. We are also providing our updates in Spanish as well in the pdf at the bottom of this page.

We would like to share some community resources available for our families during this time. Below there is information on daily wellness webinars, community resources for food and assistance and other resources that have been shared with us.

In an effort to provide online instruction during this unprecedented time, the staff of HUSD has created a site for our parents and students to access grade appropriate resources. Please email your teacher with questions.
This school closure resources website is organized using the district's adopted curriculum for English Language Arts (WONDERS) and Math (Eureka). The website provides each grade level with numerous routines/skills as well as activities to do at home. These routines/skills are review skills that have been previously taught, and the activities are age-appropriate so students can complete them on their own. These activities can be printed by request by emailing diane.sallinger@humboldtunified.com.
Included in each grade level section are:
-English Language Arts skills
-Math skills
-Activities
This site will be continually updated. We are in the process of capturing resources for the middle school and high school grade levels on this site. Because they have larger needs, we need some additional time to include resources on those tabs. We thank you for your patience.
If you have questions please email your teacher for assistance.

td.a: Arizona Auditor General Spending Report FY2019

img.br:
Arizona Revised Statutes Â§41-1279.03(A)(9) requires school districts to prominently post on their website home pages a copy of their profile page from the most recent report.
The full report contains State-wide spending trend information and comparisons to national averages and is available on our website at the link below.

td.a: Congratulations to the February 2020 Teacher of the Month - Lindsey Buckle

img.br:
Rigor, relevance, and relationships. These are the buzz words of education. Today it is each teacherâs responsibility to teach content in a way that his or her students will make a connection. Lindsey has served the Humboldt Unified School District for the past five and a half years as a math instructor at Bradshaw Mountain High School and Bradshaw Mountain Middle School. At BMHS she has taught Algebra, Geometry and AP Statistics. Her AP Statistics course is one of our AP courses offered for our seniors who are planning on attending college. Lindseyâs excellence in instruction, coupled with her leadership skills, makes her a vital part of not only the math department, but the entire educational community as a whole.
Lindsey Buckle not only creates a dynamic learning environment based on student achievement through real-life application, she also has the innate ability to push students to their fullest potential. Regardless if it is one of her freshman in her Algebra 1B class or one of her seniors in her AP Statistics class, she motivates them the same. She consistently provides high-quality, engaging instruction that prepares her students to be successful participants within our community. The level of rigor in her class rivals any Advanced Placement course offered. Though Lindsey entered education later in her career, her teaching pedagogy is unparalleled, and her exemplary performance in the classroom has earned her the respect and admiration of her colleagues and administrators.
